fun_facts: Apples float in water because they are 25% air.
There are over 7,500 known varieties of apples grown worldwide.
It takes the energy from 50 apple leaves to produce one apple.
Oranges are a hybrid, possibly between pomelo and mandarin.
The color orange was named after the fruit, not the other way around.
Brazil is the world's largest producer of oranges.
Bananas are technically berries.
Banana plants are the largest herbaceous flowering plants.
Humans share about 50% of their DNA with bananas.
Grapes have been cultivated for over 8,000 years.
It takes about 2.5 pounds of grapes to make one bottle of wine.
There are over 8,000 varieties of grapes worldwide.
Strawberries are the only fruit with seeds on the outside.
On average, a strawberry has 200 seeds.
Strawberries belong to the rose family.
Watermelons are considered both a fruit and a vegetable.
The world's heaviest watermelon weighed over 350 pounds (159 kg).
Early explorers used watermelons as canteens.
This fruit seems interesting! Unfortunately, we don't have specific facts for it yet.
Did you know fruits are nature's candy?
